values.name: transformation_rule
values.description:
Secondary login Transformation rule
${LOGIN} will be replaced by login
${DOMAIN} (optional) will be replaced by domain if it exists.
Empty value means no transformation rule.

values.name: vault_transformation_rule
values.description:
Account Mapping password retriever
Transformation to apply to find the correct account.
${USER} will be replaced by the user's login.
${DOMAIN} will be replaced by the user's domain (in case of LDAP mapping).
${USER_DOMAIN} will be replaced by the user's login + "@" + user's domain (or just user's login if there's no domain).
${GROUP} will be replaced by the authorization's user group.
${DEVICE} will be replaced by the device's name.
A regular expression is allowed to transform a variable, with the syntax: ${USER:/regex/replacement}, groups can be captured with parentheses and used with \1, \2, ...
For example to replace leading "A" by "B" in the username: ${USER:/^A/B}
Empty value means no transformation rule.

values.name: front_connection_time
values.description: From incoming connection to "up_and_running" state.

values.name: target_connection_time
values.description: From Module rdp creation to "up_and_running" state.

values.name: port
values.description:
Port of RDP Proxy service.

Changing the port number will restart the service and disconnect active sessions. It will also block WALLIX Access Manager connections unless its RDP port is configured.
Choose a port that is not already in use. Otherwise, the service will not run.

values.name: authfile
values.description: Socket path or socket address of passthrough / ACL.

values.name: handshake_timeout
values.description:
Timeout during RDP connection initialization.
Increase this value if the connection between workstations and Bastion is slow.

values.name: base_inactivity_timeout
values.description:
No automatic disconnection due to inactivity, timer is set on primary authentication.
If the value is between 1 and 30, then 30 is used.
If the value is set to 0, then inactivity timeout value is unlimited.

values.name: inactivity_timeout
values.description: No automatic disconnection due to inactivity, timer is set on target session. If the value is between 1 and 30, then 30 is used. If the value is set to 0, then the value set in "Base inactivity timeout" option (in "globals" section of "RDP Proxy" configuration option) is used.

values.name: keepalive_grace_delay
values.description: Internal keepalive between ACL and RDP proxy.

values.name: authentication_timeout
values.description: Specifies how long the RDP proxy login screen should be displayed before the client window closes (use 0 to deactivate).

values.name: trace_type
values.description: Session record options.

values.name: listen_address
values.description: Specify bind address.

values.name: enable_transparent_mode
values.description: Transparent mode allows network traffic interception for a target, even when users directly specify a target's address instead of a proxy address.

values.name: certificate_password
values.description: Proxy certificate password.

values.name: enable_bitmap_update
values.description: Support of Bitmap Update.

values.name: enable_end_time_warning_osd
values.description:
Displays a reminder box at the top of the session when a session has a time limit (timeframe or approval).
Reminders appear at 30 minutes, 10 minutes, 5 minutes, and 1 minute before the session ends.

values.name: enable_osd_display_remote_target
values.description: Allows showing the target device name with F12 during the session.

values.name: show_target_user_in_f12_message
values.description: Displays the target username in the session when F12 is pressed. This option needs "Enable OSD display remote target" option.

values.name: large_pointer_support
values.description:
Enable support for 96x96 size pointers.
⚠ If this option is disabled and the application does not support smaller pointers, the pointer may remain stuck on the last active pointer. For example, the resize window pointer would remain visible rather than change to a 'normal' pointer.

values.name: rdp_keepalive_connection_interval
values.description:
Prevent Remote Desktop session timeouts due to idle TCP sessions by periodically sending keepalive packets to the client.
Set to 0 to disable this feature.

values.name: enable_ipv6
values.description:
⚠ Manually restart service redemption to take changes into account.

Enable primary connection on IPv6.

values.name: minimal_memory_available_before_connection_silently_closed
values.description: 0 for disabled.

values.name: ignore_logon_password
values.description: If true, ignore the password provided by the RDP client. The user needs to manually log in.

values.name: allow_using_multiple_monitors
values.description:
Sends the client screen count to the target server. Not supported for VNC targets.
Uncheck to disable multiple monitors.

values.name: allow_scale_factor
values.description:
Sends Scale & Layout configuration to the target server.
On Windows 11, this corresponds to the options "Scale", "Display Resolution" and "Display Orientation" of Settings > System > Display.
⚠ Title bar detection via OCR will no longer work.

values.name: unicode_keyboard_event_support
values.description:
Allows the client to use unicode characters.
This is useful for displaying characters that are not available on the keyboard layout used, such as some special characters or emojis.

values.name: encryption_level
values.description: Legacy encryption when External Security Protocol (TLS, CredSSP, etc) is disabled.

values.name: tls_fallback_legacy
values.description:
Fallback to RDP Legacy Encryption if the client does not support TLS.
⚠ Enabling this option is a security risk.

values.name: tls_support
values.description: Enable TLS between client and proxy.

values.name: tls_min_level
values.description:
Minimal incoming TLS level: 0=TLSv1, 1=TLSv1.1, 2=TLSv1.2, 3=TLSv1.3
⚠ Lower this value only for compatibility reasons.

values.name: tls_max_level
values.description:
Maximal incoming TLS level: 0=no restriction, 1=TLSv1.1, 2=TLSv1.2, 3=TLSv1.3
⚠ Change this value only for compatibility reasons.

values.name: ssl_cipher_list
values.description:
[Not configured]: Compatible with more RDP clients (less secure)
HIGH:!ADH:!3DES: Compatible only with MS Windows 7 client or more recent (moderately secure)
HIGH:!ADH:!3DES:!SHA: Compatible only with MS Server Windows 2008 R2 client or more recent (more secure)
The format used is described on this page: https://www.openssl.org/docs/man3.1/man1/openssl-ciphers.html#CIPHER-LIST-FORMAT

values.name: tls_1_3_ciphersuites
values.description:
Configure the available TLSv1.3 ciphersuites.
Empty to apply system-wide configuration.
The format used is described in the third paragraph of this page: https://www.openssl.org/docs/man1.1.1/man3/SSL_CTX_set_ciphersuites.html#DESCRIPTION

values.name: tls_key_exchange_groups
values.description:
Configure the supported key exchange groups.
Empty to apply system-wide configuration.
The format used is described in this page: https://www.openssl.org/docs/man3.2/man3/SSL_CONF_cmd.html#groups-groups

values.name: tls_signature_algorithms
values.description:
Configure the supported server signature algorithms.
Empty to apply system-wide configuration.
The format should be a colon separated list of signature algorithms in order of decreasing preference of the form algorithm+hash or signature_scheme.
algorithm is one of RSA, RSA-PSS or ECDSA.
hash is one of SHA224, SHA256, SHA384 or SHA512.
signature_scheme is one of the signature schemes defined in TLSv1.3 (rfc8446#section-4.2.3), specified using the IETF name, e.g., ecdsa_secp384r1_sha384 or rsa_pss_rsae_sha256.
This list needs at least one signature algorithm compatible with the RDP Proxy certificate.

values.name: show_common_cipher_list
values.description:
Show the common cipher list supported by client and target server in the logs.
⚠ Only for debugging purposes.

values.name: enable_nla
values.description: Needed for primary NTLM or Kerberos connections over NLA.

values.name: disable_tsk_switch_shortcuts
values.description: If enabled, ignore Ctrl+Alt+Del, Ctrl+Shift+Esc and Windows+Tab keyboard sequences.

values.name: rdp_compression
values.description: Specifies the highest RDP compression support available on the client connection session.

values.name: max_color_depth
values.description: Specifies the maximum color depth for the client connection session:

values.name: persistent_disk_bitmap_cache
values.description: Persistent Disk Bitmap Cache on the primary connection side. If the RDP client supports it, this setting increases the size of image caches.

values.name: cache_waiting_list
values.description: Support of Cache Waiting List: Experimental cache strategy (this value is ignored if [client]persistent_disk_bitmap_cache is disabled).

values.name: persist_bitmap_cache_on_disk
values.description: If enabled, the content of Persistent Bitmap Caches are stored on the disk to reuse later (this value is ignored if "Persistent disk bitmap cache" option is disabled).

values.name: bitmap_compression
values.description:
Enable Bitmap Compression when supported by the RDP client.
Disabling this option increases the network bandwith usage.

values.name: fast_path
values.description: Enables support of Client Fast-Path Input Event PDUs.

values.name: enable_suppress_output
values.description:
Allows the client to request the target server to stop graphical updates. For example, when the RDP client window is minimized to reduce bandwidth.
⚠ If changes occur on the target, they will not be visible in the recordings either.

values.name: bogus_ios_glyph_support_level
values.description: Same effect as "Transform glyph to bitmap" option, but only for RDP clients on an iOS platform.

values.name: transform_glyph_to_bitmap
values.description: This option converts glyphs to bitmaps to resolve issues with certain RDP clients.

values.name: enable_osd_4_eyes
values.description: Informs users with a message when their session is audited.

values.name: enable_remotefx
values.description: Enable RemoteFX on the client connection. Needs - "Max color depth" option set to 32 (32-bit RGB mask + alpha) - "Enable RemoteFX" option (in "rdp" section of "Connection Policy" configuration) set to on

values.name: disabled_orders
values.description:
This option should only be used if the target server or client is showing graphical issues.
In general, disabling RDP orders has a negative impact on performance.

Drawing orders that can be disabled:
   0: DstBlt
   1: PatBlt
   2: ScrBlt
   3: MemBlt
   4: Mem3Blt
   9: LineTo
  15: MultiDstBlt
  16: MultiPatBlt
  17: MultiScrBlt
  18: MultiOpaqueRect
  22: Polyline
  25: EllipseSC
  27: GlyphIndex

values.name: workaround_incomplete_images
values.description:
This option fixes a bug in the Remote Desktop client on Windows 11/Windows Server 2025 starting with version 24H2.
Occasionally, some screen areas may not refresh due to a bug where only the first image in a BitmapUpdate message with multiple images is displayed correctly.
Enabling this option prevents this issue, but will slightly increase the data sent to the client.
The option is automatically disabled if the connection is from an Access Manager.

values.name: connection_establishment_timeout
values.description: The maximum wait time for the proxy to connect to a target.

values.name: tcp_user_timeout
values.description: This parameter allows you to specify max timeout before a TCP connection is aborted. If the option value is specified as 0, TCP will use the system default.

values.name: allow_resize_hosted_desktop
values.description:
Allows resizing of a desktop session opened in a RemoteApp window.
This happens when an RDP client opened in RemoteApp accesses a desktop target.

values.name: force_performance_flags
values.description:
It specifies a list of (comma-separated) RDP server desktop features to enable or disable in the session (with the goal of optimizing bandwidth usage).

If a feature is preceded by a "-" sign, it is disabled; if it is preceded by a "+" sign or no sign, it is enabled. Unconfigured features can be controlled by the RDP client.

Available features:
  - wallpaper
  - full_window_drag
  - menu_animations
  - theme
  - mouse_cursor_shadows
  - cursor_blinking
  - font_smoothing
  - desktop_composition

values.name: auto_adjust_performance_flags
values.description:
If enabled, the font smoothing desktop feature is automatically disabled in recorded session.
This allows OCR (when session probe is disabled) to better detect window titles.
If disabled, it allows font smoothing in recorded sessions. However, OCR will not work when session recording is disabled. In this case, window titles are not detected.

values.name: rdp_compression
values.description: Specifies the highest RDP compression support available on the target server connection.

values.name: open_session_timeout
values.description:
The maximum wait time for the proxy to log on to an RDP session.
Value 0 is equivalent to 15 seconds.

values.name: disabled_orders
values.description:
This option should only be used if the target server or client is showing graphical issues.
In general, disabling RDP orders has a negative impact on performance.

Drawing orders that can be disabled:
   0: DstBlt
   1: PatBlt
   2: ScrBlt
   3: MemBlt
   4: Mem3Blt
   9: LineTo
  15: MultiDstBlt
  16: MultiPatBlt
  17: MultiScrBlt
  18: MultiOpaqueRect
  22: Polyline
  25: EllipseSC
  27: GlyphIndex

values.name: enable_nla
values.description: Enable NLA authentication in secondary targets.

values.name: enable_kerberos
values.description: When "Enable NLA" is selected: Enabling this option instructs the Bastion to use Kerberos as its initial method. Disabling this option instructs the Bastion to only use NTLM.

values.name: allow_nla_ntlm_fallback
values.description: When both "Enable NLA" and "Enable Kerberos" are selected: Enabling this option instructs the Bastion to use Kerberos first and, if necessary, NTLM as a backup. Disabling this option instructs the Bastion to only use Kerberos.

values.name: allow_tls_only_fallback
values.description: Allow TLS only.

values.name: allow_rdp_legacy_fallback
values.description: Allow Standard RDP Security (Legacy).

values.name: tls_min_level
values.description: Minimal incoming TLS level 0=TLSv1, 1=TLSv1.1, 2=TLSv1.2, 3=TLSv1.3

values.name: tls_max_level
values.description: Maximal incoming TLS level 0=no restriction, 1=TLSv1.1, 2=TLSv1.2, 3=TLSv1.3

values.name: cipher_string
values.description:
TLSv1.2 and below additional ciphers supported.
Empty to apply system-wide configuration (SSL security level 2), ALL for support of all ciphers to ensure highest compatibility with target servers.
The format used is described on this page: https://www.openssl.org/docs/man3.1/man1/openssl-ciphers.html#CIPHER-LIST-FORMAT

values.name: tls_enable_legacy_server
values.description: Allow TLS legacy insecure renegotiation to unpatched target servers. For Windows Server 2008, requires also to set ALL@SECLEVEL=0 in "Cipher string" option.

values.name: tls_1_3_ciphersuites
values.description:
Configure the available TLSv1.3 ciphersuites.
Empty to apply system-wide configuration.
The format used is described in the third paragraph of this page: https://www.openssl.org/docs/man1.1.1/man3/SSL_CTX_set_ciphersuites.html#DESCRIPTION

values.name: tls_key_exchange_groups
values.description:
Configure the supported key exchange groups.
Empty to apply system-wide configuration.
The format used is described in this page: https://www.openssl.org/docs/man3.2/man3/SSL_CONF_cmd.html#groups-groups

values.name: show_common_cipher_list
values.description:
Show in the logs the common cipher list supported by client and target server
⚠ Only for debugging purposes.

values.name: persistent_disk_bitmap_cache
values.description: Persistent Disk Bitmap Cache on the secondary connection side. If supported by the RDP target server, the size of image caches will be increased.

values.name: cache_waiting_list
values.description: Support of Cache Waiting List (this value is ignored if the "Persistent disk bitmap cache" option is disabled).

values.name: persist_bitmap_cache_on_disk
values.description: If enabled, the contents of Persistent Bitmap Caches are stored on disk for reusing them later (this value is ignored if "Persistent disk bitmap cache" option is disabled).

values.name: allowed_channels
values.description: List of (comma-separated) enabled (static) virtual channel. If character '*' is used as a name then enables everything. Explicit names have higher priority than '*' in [mod_rdp]denied_channels.

values.name: denied_channels
values.description: List of (comma-separated) disabled (static) virtual channel. If character '*' is used as a name then disables everything. Explicit names have higher priority than '*' in [mod_rdp]allowed_channels.

values.name: allowed_dynamic_channels
values.description: List of (comma-separated) enabled dynamic virtual channel. If character '*' is used as a name then enables everything. Explicit names have higher priority than '*' in "Denied dynamic channels" option.

values.name: denied_dynamic_channels
values.description: List of (comma-separated) disabled dynamic virtual channel. If character '*' is used as a name then disables everything. Explicit names have higher priority than '*' in "Allowed dynamic channels" option.

values.name: disable_coreinput_dynamic_channel
values.description:
If this option is unchecked, keyboard/mouse inputs are transmitted over the dynamic virtual channel.
This will cause the session inactivity detection and keyboard input log to malfunction in Windows 11 and Windows Server 2025.

values.name: force_screen_resolution
values.description:
Force the screen resolution of a RDP target.
This option is ignored when the value is 0x0 or empty.

values.name: fast_path
values.description:
Enables support of Client/Server Fast-Path Input/Update PDUs.
Fast-Path is required for Windows Server 2012 (or more recent).

values.name: server_redirection_support
values.description: The secondary target connection can be redirected to a specific session on another RDP server.

values.name: load_balance_info
values.description:
Load balancing information.
For example 'tsv://MS Terminal Services Plugin.1.Sessions' where 'Sessions' is the name of the targeted RD Collection which works fine.

values.name: client_address_sent
values.description: Client Address to send to target (in InfoPacket).

values.name: proxy_managed_drives
values.description:
Shared directory between proxy and secondary target.
Requires RDPDR support.

values.name: auth_channel
values.description: Authentication channel used by Auto IT scripts. May be '*' to use default name. Keep empty to disable virtual channel.

values.name: checkout_channel
values.description: Authentication channel used by other scripts. No default name. Keep empty to disable virtual channel.

values.name: use_client_provided_alternate_shell
values.description: As far as possible, use client-provided initial program (Alternate Shell).

values.name: use_client_provided_remoteapp
values.description: As far as possible, use client-provided remote program (RemoteApp).

values.name: use_native_remoteapp_capability
values.description: As far as possible, use native RemoteApp capability.

values.name: hide_client_name
values.description:
Do not transmit the client machine name to the RDP server.
If Per-Device licensing mode is configured on the RD host, this Bastion will consume a CAL for all of these connections to the RD host.

values.name: use_license_store
values.description: Stores CALs issued by the terminal servers.

values.name: bogus_freerdp_clipboard
values.description: Workaround option to support partial clipboard initialization performed by some versions of FreeRDP.

values.name: bogus_ios_rdpdr_virtual_channel
values.description: Workaround option to disable shared disk for RDP client on iOS platform only.

values.name: bogus_refresh_rect
values.description:
Workaround option to fix some drawing issues with Windows Server 2012.
Can be disabled when none of the targets are Windows Server 2012.

values.name: enable_rdpdr_data_analysis
values.description: Adds RDPDR channel metadata to session logs. Disabling this option makes shared disks more responsive, but metadata will no longer be collected.if at least one authorization of RDPDR is missing (Printer, ComPort, SmartCard, Drive), then this option is considered enabled.

values.name: remoteapp_bypass_legal_notice_delay
values.description:
Delay before automatically bypassing Windows's Legal Notice screen in RemoteApp mode.
Set to 0 to disable this feature.

values.name: remoteapp_bypass_legal_notice_timeout
values.description:
Time limit to automatically bypass Windows's Legal Notice screen in RemoteApp mode.
Set to 0 to disable this feature.

values.name: log_only_relevant_clipboard_activities
values.description: Some events such as 'Preferred DropEffect' have no particular meaning. This option allows you to exclude these types of events from the logs.

values.name: split_domain
values.description: Force splitting target domain and username with '@' separator.

values.name: wabam_uses_translated_remoteapp
values.description:
Actives conversion of RemoteApp target session to desktop session.
Otherwise, Alternate Shell will be used.
Some Windows Shell features may be unavailable in one or both cases, and applications using them may behave differently.

values.name: session_shadowing_support
values.description:
Enables Session Shadowing Support.
Session probe must be enabled on target connection policy.
Target server must support "Remote Desktop Shadowing" feature.
When enabled, users can share their RDP sessions with auditors who request it.

values.name: enable_remotefx
values.description: Enables support of the RemoteFX codec on target connection.

values.name: enable_restricted_admin_mode
values.description:
Connect to the target server in Restricted Admin mode.
This mode must be supported by the target server (available from Windows Server 2012 R2), otherwise, connection will fail.
NLA must be enabled.

values.name: force_smartcard_authentication
values.description:
NLA will be disabled.
Target must be set for interactive login, otherwise the  connection may not be guaranteed.
Smartcard device must be available on client desktop.
Smartcard redirection (Proxy option RDP_SMARTCARD) must be enabled on service.

values.name: enable_ipv6
values.description: Enable target connection on IPv6

values.name: mode_console
values.description: Console mode management for targets on Windows Server 2003 (requested with /console or /admin mstsc option).

values.name: auto_reconnection_on_losing_target_link
values.description:
Allows the proxy to automatically reconnect to secondary target when a network error occurs.
The target server must support reconnection cookie.

values.name: allow_session_reconnection_by_shortcut
values.description: If the feature is enabled, the end user can trigger a session disconnection/reconnection with the shortcut Ctrl+F12. This feature should not be used together with the "End disconnected session" option (in "session_probe" section). The keyboard shortcut is fixed and cannot be changed.

values.name: session_reconnection_delay
values.description: The delay between a session disconnection and the automatic reconnection that follows.

values.name: forward_client_build_number
values.description: Forward the build number advertised by the client to the target server. If forwarding is disabled a default (static) build number will be sent to the target server.

values.name: bogus_monitor_layout_treatment
values.description: To resolve the session freeze issue with Windows 7/Windows Server 2008 target.

values.name: krb_armoring_account
values.description: Account to be used for armoring Kerberos tickets. Must be in the form 'account_name@domain_name[@device_name]'. If account resolution succeeds the username and password associated with this account will be used; otherwise the below fallback username and password will be used instead.

values.name: krb_armoring_realm
values.description: Realm to be used for armoring Kerberos tickets.

values.name: krb_armoring_fallback_user
values.description: Fallback username to be used for armoring Kerberos tickets.

values.name: krb_armoring_fallback_password
values.description: Fallback password to be used for armoring Kerberos tickets.

values.name: effective_krb_armoring_user
values.description: Effective username to be used for armoring Kerberos tickets.

values.name: effective_krb_armoring_password
values.description: Effective password to be used for armoring Kerberos tickets.

values.name: remote_programs_disconnect_message_delay
values.description: Delay before showing disconnect message after the last RemoteApp window is closed.

values.name: use_session_probe_to_launch_remote_program
values.description:
This option only has an effect in RemoteApp sessions (RDS meaning).
If enabled, the RDP Proxy relies on the Session Probe to launch the remote programs.
Otherwise, remote programs will be launched according to Remote Programs Virtual Channel Extension of Remote Desktop Protocol. This latter is the native method.
The difference is that Session Probe does not start a new application when its host session is resumed. Conversely, launching applications according to Remote Programs Virtual Channel Extension of Remote Desktop Protocol is not affected by this behavior. However, launching applications via the native method requires them to be published in Remote Desktop Services, which is unnecessary if launched by the Session Probe.
values.displayName: Use Session Probe to launch remote program

values.name: replace_null_pointer_by_default_pointer
values.description: Replace an empty mouse pointer with normal pointer.

values.name: windows_xp_clipboard_support
values.description: Enable Windows XP clipboard support.

values.name: block_user_input_until_appdriver_completes
values.description: Block user input in the session during the execution of Application Driver. Do not activate this option if the application session does not use Application Driver.
values.displayName: Block user input until Application Driver completes

values.name: use_smart_launcher
values.description:
This parameter only has an effect in Desktop sessions.
It allows you to choose between Smart launcher and Legacy launcher to launch the Session Probe.
The Smart launcher and the Legacy launcher do not have the same technical prerequisites. Detailed information can be found in the Administration guide.

values.name: enable_launch_mask
values.description:
This parameter enables or disables the Session Probe’s launch mask.
The Launch mask hides the Session Probe launch steps from the end-users.
Disabling the mask makes it easier to diagnose Session Probe launch issues. It is recommended to enable the mask for normal operation.

values.name: on_launch_failure
values.description: It is recommended to use option 1 (disconnect user).

values.name: launch_timeout
values.description: This parameter is used if "On launch failure" option is 1 (disconnect user). 0 to disable timeout.

values.name: launch_fallback_timeout
values.description: This parameter is used if "On launch failure" option is 0 (ignore failure and continue) or 2 (retry without Session Probe). 0 to disable timeout.

values.name: start_launch_timeout_timer_only_after_logon
values.description: If enabled, the "Launch timeout" option countdown timer will be started only after user logged in Windows. Otherwise, the countdown timer will be started immediately after RDP protocol connexion.

values.name: keepalive_timeout
values.description: The amount of time that RDP Proxy waits for a reply from the Session Probe to the KeepAlive message before adopting the behavior defined by "On keepalive timeout" option. If our local network is subject to congestion, or if the Windows lacks responsiveness, it is possible to increase the value of the timeout to minimize disturbances related to the behavior defined by "On keepalive timeout" option. The KeepAlive message is used to detect Session Probe unavailability. Without Session Probe, session monitoring will be minimal. No metadata will be collected. During the delay between sending a KeepAlive request and receiving the corresponding reply, Session Probe availability is indeterminate.

values.name: on_keepalive_timeout
values.description: This parameter allows us to choose the behavior of the RDP Proxy in case of losing the connection with Session Probe.

values.name: end_disconnected_session
values.description: The behavior of this parameter is different between the Desktop session and the RemoteApp session (RDS meaning). But in each case, the purpose of enabling this parameter is to not leave disconnected sessions in a state unusable by the RDP proxy. If enabled, Session Probe will automatically end the disconnected Desktop session. Otherwise, the RDP session and the applications it contains will remain active after user disconnection (unless a parameter defined at the RDS-level decides otherwise). The parameter in RemoteApp session (RDS meaning) does not cause the latter to be closed but a simple cleanup. However, this makes the session suitable for reuse. This parameter must be enabled for Web applications because an existing session with a running browser cannot be reused. It is also recommended to enable this parameter for connections in RemoteApp mode (RDS meaning) when "Use Session Probe to launch remote program" option (in "rdp" section) is enabled. Because an existing Session Probe does not launch a startup program (a new Bastion application) when the RemoteApp session resumes.

values.name: enable_autodeployed_appdriver_affinity
values.description: If enabled, disconnected auto-deployed Application Driver session will automatically terminate by Session Probe.

values.name: enable_log
values.description:
This parameter allows you to enable the Windows-side logging of Session Probe.
The generated files are located in the Windows user's temporary directory. These files can only be analyzed by the WALLIX team.
This log does not help diagnose a launch problem. For this, you should instead use the debugging settings in the Configuration options.

values.name: enable_log_rotation
values.description:
This parameter enables or disables the Log files rotation for Windows-side logging of Session Probe.
The Log files rotation helps reduce disk space consumption caused by logging. But the interesting information may be lost if the corresponding file is not retrieved in time.

values.name: log_level
values.description: Defines logging severity levels.

values.name: disconnected_application_limit
values.description:
(Deprecated!)
The period above which the disconnected Application session will be automatically closed by the Session Probe.
0 to disable timeout.

values.name: disconnected_session_limit
values.description:
The period above which the disconnected Desktop session will be automatically closed by the Session Probe.
0 to disable timeout.

values.name: idle_session_limit
values.description:
The period of user inactivity above which the session will be locked by the Session Probe.
0 to disable timeout.

values.name: smart_launcher_clipboard_initialization_delay
values.description: The additional period given to the device to make Clipboard redirection available. This parameter is effective only if "Use smart launcher" option is enabled. If we see the message "Clipboard Virtual Channel is unavailable" in the Bastion’s syslog and we are sure that this virtual channel is allowed on the device (confirmed by a direct connection test for example), we probably need to use this parameter.

values.name: smart_launcher_start_delay
values.description: For under-performing devices. The extra time given to the device before starting the Session Probe launch sequence. This parameter is effective only if "Use smart launcher" option is enabled. This parameter can be useful when (with Launch mask disabled) Windows Explorer is not immediately visible when the RDP session is opened.

values.name: smart_launcher_long_delay
values.description: The delay between two simulated keystrokes during the Session Probe launch sequence execution. This parameter is effective only if "Use smart launcher" option is enabled. This parameter may help if the Session Probe launch failure is caused by network slowness or device under-performance. This parameter is usually used together with the "Smart launcher short delay" option.

values.name: smart_launcher_short_delay
values.description: The delay between two steps of the same simulated keystrokes during the Session Probe launch sequence execution. This parameter is effective only if "Use smart launcher" option is enabled. This parameter may help if the Session Probe launch failure is caused by network slowness or device under-performance. This parameter is usually used together with the "Smart launcher long delay" option.

values.name: smart_launcher_enable_wabam_affinity
values.description: Allow sufficient time for the RDP client (Access Manager) to respond to the Clipboard virtual channel initialization message. Otherwise, the time granted to the RDP client (Access Manager or another) for Clipboard virtual channel initialization will be defined by the "Smart launcher clipboard initialization delay" option. This parameter is effective only if "Use smart launcher" option is enabled and the RDP client is Access Manager.
values.displayName: Enable Smart launcher with AM affinity

values.name: launcher_abort_delay
values.description:
The time interval between the detection of an error (example: a refusal by the target of the redirected drive) and the actual abandonment of the Session Probe launch.
The purpose of this parameter is to give the target time to gracefully stop some ongoing processing.
It is strongly recommended to keep the default value of this parameter.

values.name: enable_crash_dump
values.description:
This parameter enables or disables the crash dump generation when the Session Probe encounters a fatal error.
The crash dump file is useful for post-modem debugging. It is not designed for normal use.
The generated files are located in the Windows user's temporary directory. These files can only be analyzed by the WALLIX team.
There is no rotation mechanism to limit the number of dump files produced. Extended activation of this parameter can quickly exhaust disk space.

values.name: handle_usage_limit
values.description: Use only if you see unusually high consumption of system object handles by the Session Probe. The Session Probe will sabotage and then restart it-self if it consumes more handles than what is defined by this parameter. A value of 0 disables this feature. This feature can cause the session to be disconnected if the value of the "On keepalive timeout" option is set to 1 (Disconnect user). If "Allow multiple handshakes" option (in "session_probe" section of "RDP Proxy" configuration option) is disabled, restarting the Session Probe will cause the session to disconnect.

values.name: memory_usage_limit
values.description: Use only if you see unusually high consumption of memory by the Session Probe. The Session Probe will sabotage and then restart it-self if it consumes more memory than what is defined by this parameter. A value of 0 disables this feature. This feature can cause the session to be disconnected if the value of the "On keepalive timeout" option is set to 1 (Disconnect user). If "Allow multiple handshakes" option (in "session_probe" section of "RDP Proxy" configuration option) is disabled, restarting the Session Probe will cause the session to disconnect.

values.name: cpu_usage_alarm_threshold
values.description: This debugging feature was created to determine the cause of high CPU consumption by Session Probe in certain environments. As a percentage, the effective alarm threshold is calculated in relation to the reference consumption determined at the start of the program execution. The alarm is deactivated if this value of parameter is less than 200 (200% of reference consumption). When CPU consumption exceeds the allowed limit, debugging information can be collected (if the Windows-side logging is enabled), then Session Probe will sabotage. Additional behavior is defined by "CPU usage alarm action" option.

values.name: cpu_usage_alarm_action
values.description: Additional behavior when CPU consumption exceeds what is allowed. Refer to the "CPU usage alarm threshold" option.

values.name: end_of_session_check_delay_time
values.description:
For application session only.
The delay between the launch of the application and the start of End of session check.
Sometimes an application takes a long time to create its window. If the End of session check is start too early, the Session Probe may mistakenly conclude that there is no longer any active process in the session. And without active processes, the application session will be logged off by the Session Probe.
'End of session check delay time' allow you to delay the start of End of session check in order to give the application the time to create its window.

values.name: ignore_ui_less_processes_during_end_of_session_check
values.description:
For application session only.
If enabled, during the End of session check, the processes that do not have a visible window will not be counted as active processes of the session. Without active processes, the application session will be logged off by the Session Probe.
values.displayName: Ignore UI less processes during end of session check

values.name: extra_system_processes
values.description:
This parameter is used to provide the list of (comma-separated) system processes that can be run in the session.
Ex.: dllhos.exe,TSTheme.exe
Unlike user processes, system processes do not keep the session open. A session with no user process will be automatically closed by Session Probe after starting the End of session check.

values.name: childless_window_as_unidentified_input_field
values.description: This parameter concerns the functionality of the Password field detection performed by the Session Probe. This detection is necessary to avoid logging the text entered in the password fields as metadata of session (also known as Session log). Unfortunately, the detection does not work with applications developed in Java, Flash, etc. In order to work around the problem, we will treat the windows of these applications as input fields of unknown type. Therefore, the text entered in these will not be included in the session’s metadata. One of the specifics of these applications is that their main windows do not have any child window from point of view of WIN32 API. Activating this parameter allows this property to be used to detect applications developed in Java or Flash. Refer to the "Keyboard input masking level" option (in "session_log" section).

values.name: windows_of_these_applications_as_unidentified_input_field
values.description: Comma-separated process names. (Ex.: chrome.exe,ngf.exe) This parameter concerns the functionality of the Password field detection performed by the Session Probe. This detection is necessary to avoid logging the text entered in the password fields as metadata of session (also known as Session log). Unfortunately, the detection is not infallible. In order to work around the problem, we will treat the windows of these applications as input fields of unknown type. Therefore, the text entered in these will not be included in the session’s metadata. This parameter is used to provide the list of processes whose windows are considered as input fields of unknown type. Refer to the "Keyboard input masking level" option (in "session_log" section).

values.name: update_disabled_features
values.description: This parameter is used when resuming a session hosting a existing Session Probe. If enabled, the Session Probe will activate or deactivate features according to the value of "Disabled features" option received when resuming its host session. Otherwise, the Session Probe will keep the same set of features that were used during the previous connection. It is recommended to keep the default value of this parameter.

values.name: disabled_features
values.description: This parameter was created to work around some compatibility issues and to limit the CPU load that the Session Probe process causes. If 'Java Acccess Bridge' feature is disabled, data entered in the password field of Java applications may be visible in the metadata. For more information, refer to "Keyboard input masking level" option (in "session_log" section). For more information, also refer to "Childless window as unidentified input field" option and "Windows of these applications as unidentified input field" option.It is not recommended to deactivate 'MS Active Accessibility' and 'MS UI Automation' at the same time. This configuration will lead to the loss of detection of password input fields. Entries in these fields will be visible as plain text in the session metadata.

values.name: enable_bestsafe_interaction
values.description: This parameter has no effect on the device without BestSafe. Is enabled, Session Probe relies on BestSafe to perform the detection of application launches and the detection of outgoing connections. BestSafe has more efficient mechanisms in these tasks than Session Probe. For more information, refer to "Outbound connection monitoring rules" option and "Process monitoring rules" option.

values.name: on_account_manipulation
values.description: This parameter has no effect on the device without BestSafe. BestSafe interaction must be enabled. Refer to "Enable BestSafe interaction" option. This parameter allows you to choose the behavior of the RDP Proxy in case of detection of Windows account manipulation. Detectable account manipulations are the creation, deletion of a Windows account, and the addition and deletion of an account from a Windows user group.

values.name: alternate_directory_environment_variable
values.description:
This parameter is used to indicate the name of an environment variable, to be set on the Windows device, and pointed to a directory (on the device) that can be used to store and start the Session Probe. The environment variable must be available in the Windows user session.
The environment variable name is limited to 3 characters or less.
By default, the Session Probe will be stored and started from the temporary directory of Windows user.
This parameter is useful if a GPO prevents Session Probe from starting from the Windows user's temporary directory.

values.name: public_session
values.description:
If enabled, the session, once disconnected, can be resumed by another Bastion user.
Except in special cases, this is usually a security problem.
By default, a session can only be resumed by the Bastion user who created it.

values.name: outbound_connection_monitoring_rules
values.description: This parameter is used to provide the list of (comma-separated) rules used to monitor outgoing connections created in the session. (Ex. IPv4 addresses: $deny:192.168.0.0/24:5900,$allow:192.168.0.110:21) (Ex. IPv6 addresses: $deny:2001:0db8:85a3:0000:0000:8a2e:0370:7334:3389,$allow:[20D1:0:3238:DFE1:63::FEFB]:21) (Ex. hostname can be used to resolve to both IPv4 and IPv6 addresses: $allow:host.domain.net:3389) (Ex. for backwards compatibility only: 10.1.0.0/16:22) A global rule that matches all IP addresses/Ports such as "0.0.0.0/0:*" is highly unrecommended. Session Probe must be enabled to use this feature. BestSafe can be used to perform detection of outgoing connections created in the session. Refer to "Enable BestSafe interaction" option.

values.name: process_monitoring_rules
values.description: This parameter is used to provide the list of (comma-separated) rules used to monitor the execution of processes in the session. (Ex.: $deny:taskmgr.exe) @ = All child processes of (Bastion) application (Ex.: $deny:@) BestSafe can be used to perform detection of process launched in the session. Refer to "Enable BestSafe interaction" option.

values.name: customize_executable_name
values.description:
If enabled, a string of random characters will be added to the name of the Session Probe executable.
The result could be: SesProbe-5420.exe
Some other features automatically enable customization of the Session Probe executable name. Application Driver auto-deployment for example.

values.name: allow_multiple_handshake
values.description: If enabled, the RDP Proxy accepts to perform the handshake several times during the same RDP session. Otherwise, any new handshake attempt will interrupt the current session with the display of an alert message.

values.name: at_end_of_session_freeze_connection_and_wait
values.description:
If disabled, the RDP proxy disconnects from the session when the Session Probe reports that the session is about to close (old behavior).
The new session end procedure (freeze and wait) prevents another connection from resuming a session that is close to end-of-life.

values.name: periodic_task_run_interval
values.description:
Time between two polling performed by Session Probe.
The parameter is created to adapt the CPU consumption to the performance of the Windows device.
The longer this interval, the less detailed the session metadata collection and the lower the CPU consumption.

values.name: pause_if_session_is_disconnected
values.description:
If enabled, Session Probe activity will be minimized when the user is disconnected from the session. No metadata will be collected during this time.
The purpose of this behavior is to optimize CPU consumption.

values.name: monitor_own_resources_consumption
values.description:
If enabled, Session Probe will monitor its own system resource consumption.
This feature increases CPU consumption.

values.name: server_cert_store
values.description: Keep known target server certificates on Bastion

values.name: server_cert_check
values.description: Behavior of certificates check.

values.name: server_access_allowed_message
values.description: Warn if check allow connexion to target server.

values.name: server_cert_create_message
values.description: Warn that new target server certificate file was created.

values.name: server_cert_success_message
values.description: Warn that target server certificate file was successfully checked.

values.name: server_cert_failure_message
values.description: Warn that target server certificate file checking failed.

values.name: error_message
values.description: Warn that target server certificate check raised some internal error.

values.name: external_response
values.description: empty string for wait, 'Ok' or error message.

values.name: clipboard_up
values.description:
Check this option to enable the clipboard upload (from client to target server).
This only supports text data clipboard (not files).

values.name: clipboard_down
values.description:
Check this option to enable the clipboard download (from target server to client).
This only supports text data clipboard (not files).

values.name: encodings
values.description:
Sets additional graphics encoding types that will be negotiated with the VNC target server:
  2: RRE
  5: HEXTILE
  16: ZRLE

values.name: server_clipboard_encoding_type
values.description: VNC target server clipboard text data encoding type.

values.name: bogus_clipboard_infinite_loop
values.description:
The RDP clipboard is based on a token that indicates who owns data between target server and client. However, some RDP clients, such as FreeRDP, always appropriate this token. This conflicts with VNC, which also appropriates this token, causing clipboard data to be sent in loops.
This option indicates the strategy to adopt in such situations.

values.name: server_unix_alt
values.description: When disabled, Ctrl + Alt becomes AltGr (Windows behavior).

values.name: enable_ipv6
values.description: Enable target connection on IPv6.

values.name: tls_min_level
values.description: Minimal incoming TLS level 0=TLSv1, 1=TLSv1.1, 2=TLSv1.2, 3=TLSv1.3

values.name: tls_max_level
values.description: Maximal incoming TLS level 0=no restriction, 1=TLSv1.1, 2=TLSv1.2, 3=TLSv1.3

values.name: cipher_string
values.description:
TLSv1.2 and below additional ciphers supported.
Empty to apply system-wide configuration (SSL security level 2), ALL for support of all ciphers to ensure highest compatibility with target servers.
The format used is described on this page: https://www.openssl.org/docs/man3.1/man1/openssl-ciphers.html#CIPHER-LIST-FORMAT

values.name: tls_enable_legacy_server
values.description: Allow TLS legacy insecure renegotiation to unpatched target servers.

values.name: tls_1_3_ciphersuites
values.description:
Configure the available TLSv1.3 ciphersuites.
Empty to apply system-wide configuration.
The format used is described in the third paragraph of this page: https://www.openssl.org/docs/man1.1.1/man3/SSL_CTX_set_ciphersuites.html#DESCRIPTION

values.name: tls_key_exchange_groups
values.description:
Configure the supported key exchange groups.
Empty to apply system-wide configuration.
The format used is described in this page: https://www.openssl.org/docs/man3.2/man3/SSL_CONF_cmd.html#groups-groups

values.name: show_common_cipher_list
values.description:
Show in the logs the common cipher list supported by client and target server.
⚠ Only for debugging purposes.

values.name: force_authentication_method
values.description:
When specified, force the proxy to use a specific authentication method. If this method is not supported by the target server, the connection will not be made.
  - noauth
  - vncauth
  - mslogon
  - mslogoniiauth
  - ultravnc_dsm_old
  - ultravnc_dsm_new
  - tlsnone
  - tlsvnc
  - tlsplain
  - x509none
  - x509vnc
  - x509plain

values.name: enable_session_log_file
values.description:
Saves session logs to a .log file.
The format is a date followed by one or more key="value" separated by a space on the same line.

values.name: enable_syslog_format
values.description: Writes session logs to syslog and define its format.

values.name: keyboard_input_masking_level
values.description:
Classification of input data is performed using Session Probe.
Without Session Probe, all the texts entered are considered unidentified.

values.name: version
values.description:
Selects the OCR (Optical Character Recognition) version used to detect title bars when Session Probe is not running.
Version 1 is a bit faster, but has a higher failure rate in character recognition.

values.name: interval
values.description:
Time interval between two analyses.
A value too low will affect session reactivity.

values.name: on_title_bar_only
values.description: Checks shape and color to determine if the text is on a title bar.

values.name: max_unrecog_char_rate
values.description:
Expressed in percentage,
  0   - all of characters need be recognized
  100 - accept all results

values.name: record_filebase
values.description: Basename without extension.

values.name: record_subdirectory
values.description: Subdirectory of record_path (video section).

values.name: capture_flags
values.description: Specifies the type of data to be captured:

values.name: disable_keyboard_log
values.description: Disable keyboard log: (See also "Keyboard input masking level" option (in "session_log" section))

vnc.description:
⚠ Logs may contain passwords.

Disable keyboard log:

values.name: disable_clipboard_log
values.description: Disable clipboard log:

values.name: disable_file_system_log
values.description: Disable (redirected) file system log:

values.name: wrm_break_interval
values.description:
Time between two .wrm recording files.
⚠ A value that is too small increases the disk space required for recordings.

values.name: wrm_color_depth_selection_strategy
values.description: Color depth for the Session Recording file (.wrm):

values.name: wrm_compression_algorithm
values.description: Compression method of the Session Recording file (.wrm):

values.name: file_permissions
values.description: Allow to control permissions on recorded files.

values.name: enable_keyboard_log
values.description: Show keyboard input events in the meta file. (See also "Keyboard input masking level" option (in "session_log" section of "Connection Policy" configuration) for RDP and "Disable keyboard log" option (in "capture" section of "Connection Policy" configuration) for VNC and RDP)

values.name: video_break_interval
values.description: The maximum time between two videos when no title bar is detected.

values.name: video_frame_rate
values.description:
Maximum number of images per second for video generation.
A higher value will produce smoother videos, but the file weight is higher and the generation time longer.

values.name: video_notimestamp
values.description:
In the generated video of the session record traces, remove the top left banner with the timestamp.
Can slightly speed up the video generation.

values.name: video_codec
values.description: Video codec used for video generation.

values.name: ffmpeg_options
values.description:
FFmpeg options for video codec. See https://trac.ffmpeg.org/wiki/Encode/H.264
⚠ Some browsers and video decoders don't support crf=0

values.name: play_video_with_corrupted_bitmap
values.description: Checking this option will allow to play a video with corrupted Bitmap Update.

values.name: file_permissions
values.description: Allow to control permissions on video files.

values.name: allow_rt_without_recording
values.description: Allow real-time view (4 eyes) without session recording enabled in the authorization.

values.name: rt_png_interval
values.description: Frame interval for 4eyes. A value lower than 6 will have no visible effect.

values.name: rt_png_limit
values.description: Number of png captures to keep.

values.name: enable_up
values.description: Enable use of ICAP service for file verification on upload.

values.name: enable_down
values.description: Enable use of ICAP service for file verification on download.

values.name: clipboard_text_up
values.description:
Verify text data via clipboard from the client to the target server.
File verification on upload must be enabled via the Enable up option.

values.name: clipboard_text_down
values.description:
Verify text data via clipboard from the target server to the client
File verification on download must be enabled via the Enable down option.

values.name: block_invalid_file_up
values.description:
Block file transfer from the client to the target server on invalid file verification.
File verification on upload must be enabled via the Enable up option.

values.name: block_invalid_file_down
values.description:
Block file transfer from the target server to the client on invalid file verification.
File verification on download must be enabled via the Enable down option.

values.name: block_invalid_clipboard_text_up
values.description:
Block text transfer from the client to the target server on invalid text verification.
Text verification on upload must be enabled via the Clipboard text up option.

values.name: block_invalid_clipboard_text_down
values.description:
Block text transfer from the target server to the client on invalid text verification.
Text verification on download must be enabled via the Clipboard text down option.

values.name: log_if_accepted
values.description: Log the files and clipboard texts that are verified and accepted. By default, only those rejected are logged.

values.name: max_file_size_rejected
values.description:
⚠ This value affects the RAM used by the session.

If option Block invalid file (up or down) is enabled, automatically reject file with greater filesize.

values.name: tmpdir
values.description: Temporary path used when files take up too much memory.

values.name: store_file
values.description:
Enable storage of transferred files (via RDP Clipboard).
⚠ Saving files can take up a lot of disk space.

values.name: host
values.description: IP or FQDN of ICAP server.

values.name: port
values.description: Port of ICAP server.

values.name: service_name
values.description: Service name on ICAP server.

values.name: tls
values.description: Activate TLS on ICAP server connection.

values.name: enable_x_context
values.description: Send X Context (Client-IP, Server-IP, Authenticated-User) to ICAP server.

values.name: filename_percent_encoding
values.description: Filename sent to ICAP as percent encoding.

values.name: host
values.description: IP or FQDN of ICAP server.

values.name: port
values.description: Port of ICAP server.

values.name: service_name
values.description: Service name on ICAP server.

values.name: tls
values.description: Activate TLS on ICAP server connection.

values.name: enable_x_context
values.description: Send X Context (Client-IP, Server-IP, Authenticated-User) to ICAP server.

values.name: filename_percent_encoding
values.description: Filename sent to ICAP as percent encoding.

values.name: enable_websocket
values.description: Enable websocket protocol (ws or wss with use_tls=1).

values.name: use_tls
values.description: Use TLS with websocket (wss).

values.name: listen_address
values.description: ${addr}:${port} or ${port} or ${unix_socket_path}

values.name: ssh_port
values.description: Port to be used for SSH tunneling

values.name: tunneling_credential_source
values.description: static_login: Static values provided in "SSH login" option & "SSH password" option fields will be used to establish the SSH tunnel. scenario_account: Scenario account provided in "Scenario account name" option field will be used to establish the SSH tunnel. (Recommended)

values.name: ssh_login
values.description: Login to be used for SSH tunneling.

values.name: ssh_password
values.description: Password to be used for SSH tunneling.

values.name: scenario_account_name
values.description:
With the following syntax: "account_name@domain_name[@[device_name]]".

Syntax for using global domain scenario account:
  "account_name@global_domain_name"

Syntax for using local domain scenario account (with automatic device name deduction):
  "account_name@local_domain_name@"

values.name: tunneling_type
values.description: Only for debugging purposes.

values.name: psid
values.description: Proxy session log id

values.name: opt_bpp
values.description: Specifies the maximum color depth for the client connection session:

values.name: enable_target_field
values.description: Allow separate target and login entries by enabling the edit target field on the login page.

values.name: keyboard_layout_proposals
values.description: List of keyboard layouts available by the internal pages button located at bottom left of some internal pages (login, selector, etc).
values.details:
Possible values in alphabetical order:

values.name: enable_close_box
values.description: Display the close screen. Displays secondary connection errors and closes automatically after the specified "Close box timeout" option value or on user request.

values.name: close_box_timeout
values.description:
Specifies the time to spend on the close box of the RDP proxy before closing client window.
⚠ Value 0 deactivates the timer and the connection remains open until the client disconnects.

values.name: on_end_of_data
values.description: 0 - Wait for Escape, 1 - End session

values.name: replay_on_loop
values.description: 0 - replay once, 1 - loop replay

values.name: login_language
values.description: The login page shows this language to all users. Once logged in, users see their preferred language.

values.name: enable_theme
values.description: Enable custom theme color configuration.

values.name: logo_path
values.description: Logo displayed when theme is enabled.

values.name: bgcolor
values.description: Background color for window, label and button.

values.name: fgcolor
values.description: Foreground color for window, label and button.

values.name: separator_color
values.description: Separator line color used with some widgets.

values.name: focus_color
values.description: Background color used by buttons when they have focus.

values.name: error_color
values.description: Text color for error messages. For example, an authentication error in the login.

values.name: edit_bgcolor
values.description: Background color for editing field.

values.name: edit_fgcolor
values.description: Foreground color for editing field.

values.name: edit_border_color
values.description: Outline color for editing field.

values.name: edit_focus_border_color
values.description: Outline color for editing field that has focus.

values.name: edit_cursor_color
values.description: Cursor color for editing field.

values.name: edit_placeholder_color
values.description: Placeholder text color for editing field with a little resolution.

values.name: password_toggle_color
values.description: Foreground color for toggle button of password field.

values.name: tooltip_bgcolor
values.description: Background color for tooltip.

values.name: tooltip_fgcolor
values.description: Foreground color for tooltip.

values.name: tooltip_border_color
values.description: Border color for tooltip.

values.name: selector_line1_bgcolor
values.description: Background color for even rows in the selector widget.

values.name: selector_line1_fgcolor
values.description: Foreground color for even rows in the selector widget.

values.name: selector_line2_bgcolor
values.description: Background color for odd rows in the selector widget.

values.name: selector_line2_fgcolor
values.description: Foreground color for odd rows in the selector widget.

values.name: selector_focus_bgcolor
values.description: Background color for the row that has focus in the selector widget.

values.name: selector_focus_fgcolor
values.description: Foreground color for the row that has focus in the selector widget.

values.name: selector_selected_bgcolor
values.description: Background color for the row that is selected in the selector widget but does not have focus.

values.name: selector_selected_fgcolor
values.description: Foreground color for the row that is selected in the selector widget but does not have focus.

values.name: selector_label_bgcolor
values.description: Background color for name of filter fields in the selector widget.

values.name: selector_label_fgcolor
values.description: Foreground color for name of filter fields in the selector widget.

values.name: primary_user
values.description: Restrict target debugging to a specific primary user.

values.name: capture
values.description:
- kbd / ocr when != 0

(Wrm)
- pointer             = 0x0004
- primary_orders      = 0x0020
- secondary_orders    = 0x0040
- bitmap_update       = 0x0080
- surface_commands    = 0x0100
- bmp_cache           = 0x0200
- internal_buffer     = 0x0400
- sec_decrypted       = 0x1000

values.name: auth
values.description:
- variable = 0x0002
- buffer   = 0x0040
- dump     = 0x1000

values.name: session
values.description:
- Log   = 0x01
- Event = 0x02
- Acl   = 0x04
- Trace = 0x08

values.name: front
values.description:
- basic_trace     = 0x00000001
- basic_trace2    = 0x00000002
- basic_trace3    = 0x00000004
- basic_trace4    = 0x00000008
- basic_trace5    = 0x00000020
- graphic         = 0x00000040
- channel         = 0x00000080
- cache_from_disk = 0x00000400
- bmp_info        = 0x00000800
- global_channel  = 0x00002000
- sec_decrypted   = 0x00004000
- keymap          = 0x00008000
- nla             = 0x00010000
- nla_dump        = 0x00020000

(Serializer)
- pointer             = 0x00040000
- primary_orders      = 0x00200000
- secondary_orders    = 0x00400000
- bitmap_update       = 0x00800000
- surface_commands    = 0x01000000
- bmp_cache           = 0x02000000
- internal_buffer     = 0x04000000
- sec_decrypted       = 0x10000000

values.name: mod_rdp
values.description:
- basic_trace         = 0x00000001
- connection          = 0x00000002
- security            = 0x00000004
- capabilities        = 0x00000008
- license             = 0x00000010
- asynchronous_task   = 0x00000020
- graphics_pointer    = 0x00000040
- graphics            = 0x00000080
- input               = 0x00000100
- rail_order          = 0x00000200
- credssp             = 0x00000400
- negotiation         = 0x00000800
- cache_persister     = 0x00001000
- fsdrvmgr            = 0x00002000
- sesprobe_launcher   = 0x00004000
- sesprobe_repetitive = 0x00008000
- drdynvc             = 0x00010000
- surfaceCmd          = 0x00020000
- cache_from_disk     = 0x00040000
- bmp_info            = 0x00080000
- drdynvc_dump        = 0x00100000
- printer             = 0x00200000
- rdpsnd              = 0x00400000
- channels            = 0x00800000
- rail                = 0x01000000
- sesprobe            = 0x02000000
- cliprdr             = 0x04000000
- rdpdr               = 0x08000000
- rail_dump           = 0x10000000
- sesprobe_dump       = 0x20000000
- cliprdr_dump        = 0x40000000
- rdpdr_dump          = 0x80000000

values.name: mod_vnc
values.description:
- basic_trace     = 0x00000001
- keymap_stack    = 0x00000002
- draw_event      = 0x00000004
- input           = 0x00000008
- connection      = 0x00000010
- hextile_encoder = 0x00000020
- cursor_encoder  = 0x00000040
- clipboard       = 0x00000080
- zrle_encoder    = 0x00000100
- zrle_trace      = 0x00000200
- hextile_trace   = 0x00000400
- cursor_trace    = 0x00001000
- rre_encoder     = 0x00002000
- rre_trace       = 0x00004000
- raw_encoder     = 0x00008000
- raw_trace       = 0x00010000
- copyrect_encoder= 0x00020000
- copyrect_trace  = 0x00040000
- keymap          = 0x00080000

values.name: mod_internal
values.description:
- copy_paste != 0
- client_execute = 0x01

values.name: sck_mod
values.description:
- basic    = 0x0001
- dump     = 0x0002
- watchdog = 0x0004
- meta     = 0x0008

values.name: sck_front
values.description:
- basic    = 0x0001
- dump     = 0x0002
- watchdog = 0x0004
- meta     = 0x0008

values.name: compression
values.description: - when != 0

values.name: cache
values.description:
- life       = 0x0001
- persistent = 0x0200

values.name: ocr
values.description: - when != 0

values.name: ffmpeg
values.description:
Value passed to function av_log_set_level()
See https://www.ffmpeg.org/doxygen/2.3/group__lavu__log__constants.html

values.name: config
values.description: Log unknown members or sections.

values.name: mod_rdp_use_failure_simulation_socket_transport
values.displayName: Mod RDP use failure simulation socket transport

values.name: probe_client_addresses
values.description: List of client probe IP addresses (e.g. ip1, ip2, etc.) to prevent some continuous logs.
